This app is all about the loci method. This method helps you in e.g. memorizing large numbers by creating a story using images instead of the numbers itself.

This is how the app works:
 1. Click on generate number and try to memorize it. You can press menu to specify the length of the number. To memorize it, break it down into pairs of digits, and associate each 2-digit number with some item, animal, ... (you can create a spreadsheet at google docs as described below so you can see which item belongs to the different numbers). You usually create a story or walkthrough which uses the numbers and items you set up.
 2. After you have memorized the numbers go back and go to type in last number. There, press verify to see if you were right. Each try will be recorded and save to your statistics.
 3. Press statistics to see how often you were right or wrong.
 4. Go to 'Maintain list' to maintain the items for all 100 numbers. You can also go to docs.google.com and create a spreadsheet named "MemoryTrainer". There, in column 'A' fill in an item, animal, or person that you can associate with the respective row number. E.g., use 'unicorn' in row 1. For row 5 you could use 'hand'. Check out the developer's homepage to see an even lengthier description.
This is the treelist, covering all numbers from 1 to 10. There is an item associated with each number, the reason is shown in brackets. Try to memorize each number and the item to its right.
Now try to remember the items for the 5 numbers below, by imagining a story using all numbers in the same order. Then press continue to type the numbers in on the next screen.
Now type in the numbers in the same order as they were on the last screen and press the button to see if you were right.
Well done! This is how the loci method basically works. You could now go back to the main screen and try with some larger numbers and a list of 100 items (read the help there if needed).
